           <dd>&#x2022; <em>arauts&#x012b;t</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>rots&#x012b;s</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Up">Up.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>arutsi</em>, <em>aruddha</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Up">Up.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>arautsi</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AitBr">AitBr.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>arodham</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>arudhma</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MaitrS">MaitrS.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>rudh&#x00e1;t</em>, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x221a;1">&#x221a;1.</a> <em>rudh</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>arudhat</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Prec. <em>rudhy&#x0101;t</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>roddh&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>rotsyati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c. inf. <em>roddhum</em> or <em>rodhitum</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>roddhos</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>ruddhv&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a>&amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-r&#x00fa;dhya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-rundhya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-r&#x00fa;dham</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-r&#x00fa;ndham</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-r&#x00f4;dham</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>), to obstruct, check, arrest, stop, restrain, prevent, keep back, withhold <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> (always with <em>na</em>), &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to avert, keep off, repel <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;">Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.</a> (cf. <em>rudhat</em> under &#x221a;1. <em>rudh</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to shut, lock up, confine in (loc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c. (accord. to <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vop">Vop.</a> also with double acc.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to besiege, blockade, invest <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pat">Pat.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to close, block up (a path) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cover, conceal, veil, obscure <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to stop up, fill <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to lay (dust) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ragh">Ragh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to touch, move (the heart) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#B&#x0101;lar">B&#x0101;lar.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to torment, harass <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to lose, be deprived of (acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to tear, rend asunder (?) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> xix, 29, 3: Caus. <em>rodhayati</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em> and <em>rundhayati</em> <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p884-2"></a>[Page 884, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>ar&#x016b;rudhat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>rodhyate</em>), to stop, arrest <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause to be confined by (acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;car">Pa&#x00f1;car.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause to be besieged by (instr.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ragh">Ragh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to close (with a cover or lid) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bhpr">Bhpr.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to fetter, enchain, influence <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to oppress, torment, harass <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a>: Desid. <em>rorutsate</em> (cf. Br.), <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> (<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a>), to wish to obstruct &amp;c.: Intens. <em>rorudhyate</em>, <em>roroddhi</em>, to obstruct intensely or repeatedly &amp;c., Gr. (only <em>rorudha&#x1e25;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a>)</dd>

  <dt>&#x226b; ruddha </dt>
  <dd><em>ruddh&#x00e1;</em> mfn. obstructed, checked, stopped, suppressed, kept back, withheld <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
  <dd>&#x2022; shut, closed, covered <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
  <dd>&#x2022; invested, besieged, blockaded <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;cat">Pa&#x00f1;cat.</a> </dd>
  <dd>&#x2022; secured, held, taken possession of <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ruddhavasudha </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ruddhav&#x012b;rya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;v&#x012b;rya</em> mfn. one whose strength is impeded <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ragh">Ragh.</a></dd>

   <dt>&#x22d9; ruddh&#x0101;p&#x0101;&#x1e45;gaprasara </dt>
   <dd><em>ruddh&#x00e2;p&#x00e2;&#x1e45;ga-prasara</em> mfn. having the space in the outer corner (of the eye) obstructed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Megh">Megh.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ruddh&#x0101;loka </dt>
           <dd><em>ruddh&#x00e2;loka</em> mfn. obstructing the sight, dark <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; ruddhaka </dt>
           <dd><em>ruddhaka</em> n. a citron <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#N&#x012b;lak">N&#x012b;lak.</a> (w&#x1e5b;. for <em>rucaka</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; rudh 3</dt>
           <dd><em>rudh</em> (ifc.) impeding, holding ( <em>kara-r&#x25cb;</em>)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>ro&#x1e63;yate</em>), to vex, annoy, displease, irritate, exasperate <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>

   <dt>ruh 1</dt>
   <dd><em>ruh</em> (cf., &#x221a;1. <em>rudh</em>), cl. 1. P. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. N. xx, 29) <em>r&#x00f3;hati</em> (m. c. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em> and <em>ruhati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; Ved. and ep. impf. or aur. <em>aruhat</em> </dd>

   <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>ruroha</em>, <em>ruruh&#x00fa;&#x1e25;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; <em>ruruhe</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>

   <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>ro&#x1e0d;h&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; <em>rok&#x1e63;y&#x00e1;ti</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; <em>rohi&#x1e63;ye</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>

   <dd>&#x2022; <em>r&#x00f3;hi&#x1e63;yai</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>r&#x016b;&#x1e0d;hv&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a>, <em>-r&#x00fa;hya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> &amp;c </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; <em>-r&#x016b;hya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AitBr">AitBr.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; <em>-r&#x00fa;ham</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; <em>-r&#x00f3;ham</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a>), to ascend, mount, climb <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;rS">&#x015a;rS.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; to reach to, attain (a desire) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; to rise, spring up, grow, develop, increase, prosper, thrive <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (with <em>na</em>, 'to be useless or in vain' <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a>) </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; to grow together or over, cicatrize, heal (as a wound) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> &amp;c.: Caus. <em>roh&#x00e1;yati</em> or (later) <em>ropayati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (aor. <em>ar&#x016b;ruhat</em> or <em>ar&#x016b;rupat</em> Gr </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>ropyate</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a>, aor. <em>aropi</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a>), to cause to ascend, raise up, elevate <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R&#x0101;jat">R&#x0101;jat.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; to place in or on, fix in, fasten to, direct towards (with acc. or loc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; to transfer to, commit, entrust <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ragh">Ragh.</a> (cf. <em>ropita</em>) </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; to put in the ground, plant, sow <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; to lay out (a garden) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; to cause to grow, increase <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R&#x0101;jat">R&#x0101;jat.</a> </dd>
   <dd>&#x2022; to cause to grow over or heal <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a>: Desid. <em>r&#x00fa;ruk&#x1e63;ati</em>, <em>&#x0101;-&#x221a;ruh</em>: Intens. <em>roruhyate</em>, <em>roro&#x1e0d;hi</em> Gr</dd>

           <dd><em>ropa</em> &amp;c. p. 889, cols. 1, 2</dd>

           <dt>r&#x016b;k&#x1e63; </dt>
           <dd><em>r&#x016b;k&#x1e63;</em> (rather Nom. fr. <em>r&#x016b;k&#x1e63;a</em>), cl. 10. P. <em>r&#x016b;k&#x1e63;ayati</em> (cf. Vop. also <em>r&#x016b;k&#x1e63;&#x0101;payati</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>arur&#x016b;k&#x1e63;at</em>), to be rough or harsh <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a> xxxv, 56 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to make dry or emaciated <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to soil, smear <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to injure, offend, exasperate <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#J&#x0101;takam">J&#x0101;takam.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; r&#x016b;k&#x1e63;a 1</dt>
           <dd><em>r&#x016b;k&#x1e63;&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (prob. fr. &#x221a;<em>r&#x016b;&#x1e63;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#2">2.</a> <em>ruk&#x1e63;a</em>) rough, dry, arid, dreary <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; emaciated, thin <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rough to the taste, astringent <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; not greasy or oily (as food or medicine) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hard, harsh, unkind, cruel (as a person or speech) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; unpleasant, disagreeable, not soft (to the sight, smell &amp;c.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; dismal (as a house) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;cat">Pa&#x00f1;cat.</a> </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; r&#x016b;pa </dt>
           <dd><em>r&#x016b;p&#x00e1;</em> n. (perhaps connected with <em>varpa</em>, <em>varpas</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>, rarely <em>&#x012b;</em>) any outward appearance or phenomenon or colour (often pl.), form, shape, figure <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>r&#x016b;pe&#x1e47;a</em> ifc. in the form of <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p886-1"></a>[Page 886, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>r&#x016b;pam-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em> or &#x221a;<em>bh&#x016b;</em>, to assume a form </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; often ifc. = 'having the form or appearance or colour of', 'formed or composed of', 'consisting of', 'like to' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes used after an adj. or p.p. to emphasize its meaning or almost redundantly, cf. <em>ghora-r&#x25cb;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or connected with a verb, e.g. <em>pacati-r&#x016b;pam</em>, he cooks very well, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-1, 57) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; dreamy or phantom shapes (pl.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; handsome form, loveliness, grace, beauty, splendour <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; nature, character, peculiarity, feature, mark, sign, symptom <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; likeness, image, reflection <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; circumstances (opp. to 'time' and 'place') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> viii, 45 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sort, kind <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mode, manner, way <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kap">Kap.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.) trace of. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a single specimen or exemplar (and therefore a term for the number 'one') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ga&#x1e47;it">Ga&#x1e47;it.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. coin (prob. a rupee) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a show, play, drama <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Da&#x015b;ar">Da&#x015b;ar.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in alg.) the arithmetical unit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (pl.) integer number </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; known or absolute number, a known quantity as having specific form (and expressed by <em>r&#x016b;</em> i.e. first syllable of <em>r&#x016b;pa</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 182 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in gram.) any form of a noun or verb (as inflected by declension or conjugation) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-1, 68 &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in phil.) the quality of colour (one of the 17 or 24 Gu&#x1e47;as of the Vai&#x015b;eshikas) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 68 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with Buddhists) material form i.e. the organized body (as one of the 5 constituent elements or Skandhas) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dharmas">Dharmas.</a> 22 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MWB">MWB.</a> 109 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in dram.) a reflection or remark made under partic. circumstances when the action is at its height (<em>garbhe</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bhar">Bhar.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Da&#x015b;ar">Da&#x015b;ar.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (only <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a>) cattle </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a beast </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a sound, word </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rereading a book (= <em>granth&#x00e2;v&#x1e5b;tti</em>) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (in music) a kind of measure <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sa&#x1e43;g&#x012b;t">Sa&#x1e43;g&#x012b;t.</a> (cf. <em>-t&#x0101;la</em>) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; kind, species <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MaitrUp">MaitrUp.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in rhet.) a figure of speech, metapbor, comparison, simile (esp. one in which <em>iva</em>, <em>vat</em> &amp;c. are omitted, e.g. <em>b&#x0101;hu-lat&#x0101;</em>, 'a creeper- like arm', <em>pa&#x1e47;i-padma</em>, 'a lotus-like hand' <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p886-3"></a>[Page 886, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; there are 3 or 4 varieties of R&#x016b;paka, e.g. the <em>ardha-r&#x25cb;</em>, 'partial metaphor', <em>kha&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;a-r&#x25cb;</em>, 'imperfect m&#x1e6d;metaphor', and <em>lal&#x0101;ma-r&#x25cb;</em>, 'flowery metaphor') <br>          <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;vy&#x00e2;d">K&#x0101;vy&#x00e2;d.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> &amp;c. (cf. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 458) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a drama, play, theatrical performance (esp. of the principal class, as opp. to the <em>upa-r&#x016b;pakas</em> or inferior dramas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the former there are 10 species including the N&#x0101;&#x1e6d;aka or higher order of play and the Prahasana or farce) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Da&#x015b;ar">Da&#x015b;ar.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> &amp;c. (cf. IW. 471) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. weight (= 3 Gu&#x00f1;j&#x0101;s) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

   <dt>re&#x1e63; 1</dt>
   <dd><em>re&#x1e63;</em> cl. 1. &#x0100;. <em>re&#x1e63;ate</em> (pf. <em>rire&#x1e63;e</em> &amp;c., Gr.), to howl, roar, yell (as wolves) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a> xvi, 19 (others 'to neigh' or, to utter any inarticulate sound')</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; the putting or fastening on (of a bowstring) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the growing over, healing (of a wound </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>k&#x1e63;ata-r&#x25cb;</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the proceeding from, consisting of <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#V&#x0101;s">V&#x0101;s.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; semen virile <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;druma</em> m. the sandal tree <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a woman with a red face (either from anger or from being coloured with pigments) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; rohi&#x1e47;&#x012b; </dt>
           <dd><em>r&#x00f3;hi&#x1e47;&#x012b;</em> f. (f. of <em>rohita</em>, 'red', below </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also f. of <em>rohin</em> above) a red cow or <em>later</em> any cow (represented as a daughter of Surabhi and mother of cattle, esp. of K&#x0101;ma-dhenu, 'cow of plenty' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the Veda, Rohi&#x1e47;&#x012b; may perhaps also mean 'a red mare') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the ninth Nakshatra or lunar asterism and of the lunar day belonging to it (in this sense it may optionally have the accent on the last syllable </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is personified as a daughter of Daksha, and as the favourite wife of the Moon, called 'the Red one' from the colour of the star Aldebaran or principal star in the constellation which contains 5 stars, prob. ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, Tauri, and is figured by a wheeled vehicle or sometimes by a temple or fish </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is exceptionally pl., and in <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> and <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TBr">TBr.</a> there are 2 Nakshatras of this name </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it may also be used as an adj. and mean 'born under the Nakshatra Rohi&#x1e47;&#x012b;' <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 4-3, 34 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#V&#x0101;rtt">V&#x0101;rtt.</a> 1) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; lightning <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a young girl (in whom menstruation has just commenced </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; others 'a girl nine years of age') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#G&#x1e5b;ihy&#x0101;s">G&#x1e5b;ihy&#x0101;s.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;cat">Pa&#x00f1;cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of various plants <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bhpr">Bhpr.</a> (= Helleborus Niger </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Acacia Arabica </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gmelina Arborea &amp;c. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a>) </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; rohita </dt>
           <dd><em>r&#x00f3;hita</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em> or <em>i&#x1e47;&#x012b;</em>, q.v.)n. (cf. <em>lohita</em>) red, reddish <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a red or chestnut horse <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> (applied to the Sun <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> xiii, 1 &amp;c., and therefore in pl.            <dd>&#x2022; a kind of deer <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Uttarar">Uttarar.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of fish, Cyprinus Rohitaka <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of tree, Andersonia Rohitaka <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. form of rainbow (cf. n.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a son of Hari-&#x015b;candra <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AitBr">AitBr.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a Manu <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>

   <dt>raudra </dt>
   <dd><em>ra&#x00fa;dra</em> or <em>raudr&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em> or <em>&#x012b;</em>)n.
